text: The Ardmore Open was a golf tournament on the PGA Tour from 1952 to 1954. It was played at Dornick Hills Golf & Country Club in Ardmore, Oklahoma. ==Winners== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%" !Year!!Player!!Country!!Score!!To par!!Margin of victory!!Runner-up!!Winner's share ($)!!Ref |- | 1954 || Julius Boros || || align=center|279 || align=center|−1 || 1 stroke || Jerry Barber || align=right|7,200 || |- | 1953 || Earl Stewart || || align=center|282 || align=center|+2 || 3 strokes || Jerry Barber || align=right|6,900 || |- | 1952 || Dave Douglas || || align=center|279 || align=center|−1 || 2 strokes || Dutch Harrison || align=right|5,400 || |} ==See also== *Ardmore Open (LPGA Tour) – a 1954 LPGA Tour event ==References== Category:Former PGA Tour events Category:Golf in Oklahoma Category:Recurring sporting events established in 1952 Category:Recurring events disestablished in 1954 Category:1952 establishments in Oklahoma Category:1954 disestablishments in Oklahoma
title: Ardmore Open
